rComments: Noller is a pioneer in the field of Molecular Biology and the biggest contributor to our understanding of the Ribosome. In 2009, he should've won the Nobel Prize. He not the best lecturer but he is helpful during office hours. This is the most satisfying class I have ever taken. I got an A studying 3 hours a day. It was an honor to take this class.

why is he still teaching this class? not only does he mumble and monotonic, his tests are not fair in a sense that he tests for super-detail but trivial. word-limit test as he said it would refine students' thinking. Does not care about progress whatsoever! too arrogant! record the lecture and take good notes. study a lot (yes, a lot!) to pass.

not only does he mumble and monotonic, his tests are not fair in a sense that he tests for super-detail but trivial. word-limit test as he said it would refine students' thinking. Does not care about progress whatsoever! too arrogant of him! record the lecture and take good notes. study a lot (yes, a lot!) to pass. sit in the front.

unfair testing style, lots of curve ball questions. I haven't felt the need to write a review on ratemyprof for a while until finishing harry noller's class. Its not like the class is impossible, but the effort required to pass is tremendous. And to top it course is only offered once a year...

His tests structered like a spotty biochem trivia rather than a comprehensive test of knowledge, and he is a ROUGH grader. Tape recorder necessary(what he says is more important than what he writes) and he usually makes mistakes while lecturing so fact check your recordings using the book or at his OH.

Okay, like the other reviews, this class is NOT easy! I got an A in the class simply because I recorded his lectures and study A LOT and go to his office hour and multiple sections every week. He is intimidating in OH, but you have to go or you won't understand most of his test questions. There is a curve in the class, but it is not a huge one.

how the lectures apply in life situations. He's intimidating during office hour, doesn't seem like he really cares to help. I spent days and nights studying, even with dexedrine and i only got average (~55%). Has word limits so you better know your stuff. This guy ruined my life

You better have your ears glued to this guys mouth, cuz you literally need to write down every little thing he says. He mumbles sometimes, and coincidentally the stuff he mumbles is on the midterms/final. Test format is hard, long paragraph questions that intimidate you. You not only have to understand the lecture, but how they would apply..(tbc)

Get ready to say goodbye to your social life. This class is serious: takes work, patience, and repetition. Go to class, write good notes--not just what he writes on the board, but what he says (very imp!) Be active in lec! Do hw, review hw, understand hw, reread lec notes. Go to multiple sections! Tests are hard! Book isn't necessary.

He was an awesome teacher. Though his test may be a bit difficult, but he won't try to trick you. I ended up with a B although I thought I studied a lot for his class. But then again, biochem isnt supposed to be easy.

cool dude. badass and funny. attend class everyday, take great notes (a few students even voice recorded, but that seemed unnecessary,lol) i suppose the book was useful, i wouldnt know i didnt read it lol. the tests are fair and he doesnt give anything tricky. just know your stuff and you'll be good; the class takes time, so dont cram for it!

This professor is a true badass. A true master. Having pioneered in sequencing the ribosome through x-ray crystallographic techniques, Noller has literally helped to redefine the Biochemistry field. If you are a BMB major, you would be out of your mind not to take his course. I will warn you now though, it is hard, but rewarding. TAKE GOOD NOTES!!!

Harry is a great professor that even tells some ok jokes. Yes he mumbles but he's definitely not as bad as everyone says. I got a B and I studied like 4 hours a week and I got C's in gen bio and B's in Chem! As long as you go to class and write down everything on the board and listen and I mean really listen, you should be good! :)

He is a very smart professor in molecular biology. After all, he ONLY sequence the damn ribosome. Want an  A? Take good notes, record his lectures, re-listen to the lecture on your own time, add on additional notes, recopy the notes, get to know the TAs and use them!!! do the HW over n over. Memorize everything. No one says Biochem is gonna be easy

professor Noller is demanding because the major is demanding. It was an honor attending his class since he is one of the pioneers in this major. Take advantage of his presence and do the work. Nobody said BMB is going to be easy.

Dr Noller is a great person. He is not the easiest instructor but he is encouraging and helpful if you do the work. record the lectures and write down everything. His exams are entirely on HM and his own lecture. Be present in the class both mentaly and physically. After the first midterm you will realize how the rest exams are going to be.

One of the best professors you'll ever have.  Those people who talk smack on this class are stupid and shouldn't have majored in biochem to begin with.  If thats not you, then study your ass of and you'll do well.  I found the Voet-Voet book to be more helpful than the suggested book.

Noller is a tough guy, but he's 1 of the best professors I've had. He's not going to just make you memorize facts, he's going to make you do that and be able to apply them to problems you've never seen before on the test. To do well in this class, it's key to go to your TA's office hours as much as possible. You work so hard but it's worth it.

OK, we got how to succeed in Noller's interpret. of biochemistry. 1. Learn absolutely everything that he says (very easy, if you can hear and understand what he is mumbling). 2. Review it 10 times (why not 20 ?). 3. Read and memorize everything (every word, I mean). 4. Suspend any thinking, just repeat what he says. 5. Learn how to become a parrot.

Bio100A is difficult but an A is completely attainable.  Just learn absolutely everything that he says, review it 10 times, read the book, and memorize everything.  Don't like studying biochemistry four hours a day? Change your major.  If you actually like the learning the material, you will LOVE this class. All others, don't even bother trying.

This mumbling old fool should not teach any class. He knows RNA/DNA stuff, that's all. His exams are very, very bad, grad. students get barely 70. A "B-" in his class is equivalent to "A++" in other hard science class. Lots of good students fail miserably, just because he teaches poorly and gives incomprehensible exams. Avoid, if you can.

He shouldn't teach any class. I think the class itself is hard, but he made it even harder. His exams are not straight forward, even TA couldn't get it right when he didn't know the answer. I think his class is NOT fair. His teaching is so unclear, and I felt like most things I studied for the exam didn't worth. I wouldn't take this class again.

Fantastic professor.  Probably the best scientist at UCSC.  I finally felt like I got my money's worth. This course was a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to learn molecular biology from one of the fundamental contributors to the field. I felt like I had a direct hotline to God. His expectations are very high, but the payoff is substantial.
dont buy the book!!! go to classs!

I don't think he should be teaching this class anymore...i worked hard (and i'm not stupid either) but he ruinned my life and now I have to change majors to graduate on time...let's me just say...RUN FOR YOUR LIFE

He is not particularly easy to follow, the HW is hard. But going to class and section REALLY helps. His stories are rather interesting and he tries hard to make a joke sometimes. Overall he is not the most effective teacher but he definetly has a passion for the subject!

Noller teaches so poorly because he hopes not to be asked to teach again You can tell he'd rather be somewhere else when he's in the room. If you want to pass, write down EVERYTHING he says, even if it isn't on the blackboard. Study your ass off. He teaches like a softie, but tests like a hardass. This **** caught me off guard, and I barely past

Sit up close if you can. He often speaks quietly. His lectures have the feeling of a conversation, with lots of asides and by-the-way's. Lectures are essential. If you miss one, reading from the book usually won't help you. All test questions are some version of the homework questions and info for the homeworks come right from lecture.
I abhor him...
No Comments
why is he still teaching this class >_<

how can you possibly think this guy is interesting.. the class was great.. his teaching was terrible.. i couldnt tell what he was talking about.. he is very knowledgable but he doesnt know how to teach!!! NOT AT ALL!!! overall terrible professor. destroyed my passion for biochem.
Awesome teacher.  Hard class, but fascinating topic.  It's kind of hard to follow his lectures, but the class is worth taking. You miss it when it's gone.
No Comments
